info.title: Resource Reservation
info.description: **TMF API Reference : TMF 716 - Resource Reservation Management**

get.description: This operation list or find ResourceReservation entities

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

X-Result-Count.description: Actual number of items returned in the response body

X-Total-Count.description: Total number of items matching criteria

post.description: This operation creates a ResourceReservation entity.

get.description: This operation retrieves a ResourceReservation entity. Attribute selection is enabled for all first level attributes.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to provide in response

patch.description: This operation updates partially a ResourceReservation entity.

delete.description: This operation deletes a ResourceReservation entity.

get.description: This operation list or find CancelResourceReservation entities

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

X-Result-Count.description: Actual number of items returned in the response body

X-Total-Count.description: Total number of items matching criteria

post.description: This operation creates a CancelResourceReservation entity.

get.description: This operation retrieves a CancelResourceReservation entity. Attribute selection is enabled for all first level attributes.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to provide in response

post.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Data containing the callback endpoint to deliver the information

delete.description: Resets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the registered listener

post.description: Example of a client listener for receiving the notification ResourceReservationCreateEvent
Example of a client listener for receiving the notification ResourceReservationAttributeValueChangeEvent
Example of a client listener for receiving the notification ResourceReservationDeleteEvent
Example of a client listener for receiving the notification ResourceReservationStateChangeEvent
Example of a client listener for receiving the notification ResourceReservationInformationRequiredEvent
Example of a client listener for receiving the notification CancelResourceReservationCreateEvent
Example of a client listener for receiving the notification CancelResourceReservationStateChangeEvent
Example of a client listener for receiving the notification CancelResourceReservationInformationRequiredEvent

ApplicableTimePeriod.description: The period of time for which Capacity or CapacityDemand applies.

dayOfWeek.description: A day or days representing when the schedule is applicable. For example 2, 3 represent Monday and Tuesday.

rangeInterval.description:
An indicator that specifies the inclusion or exclusion of the from and to DateTime attributes. 
Possible values are "open", "closed", "closedBottom" and "closedTop".

fromToDateTime.description:
The period of time for which the schedule is applicable. 
Instance values are mutually exclusive with daysOfWeek values.

Attachment.description: Complements the description of an element (for instance a product) through video, pictures...

id.description: Unique identifier for this particular attachment

attachmentType.description: Attachment type such as video, picture

content.description: The actual contents of the attachment object, if embedded, encoded as base64

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

mimeType.description: Attachment mime type such as extension file for video, picture and document

url.description: Remote reference to the content if web-addressable

validFor.description: The period of time for which the attachment is valid

effectiveCancellationDate.description: Date when the reservation is cancelled.

requestedCancellationDate.description: Date when the submitter wants the reservation to be cancelled

Capacity.description: Specific ability of an entity measured in quantity and units of quantity over an extended period.

plannedOrActualCapacity.description: An indicator that specifies whether the capacity is planned or actual.

applicableTimePeriod.description: The period of time for which Capacity or CapacityDemand applies.

place.description:
Used to define a place useful for the resource. 
Used to indicate reserved resources.

capacityAmount.description: A value and units that define the CapacityAmount, such as 10000 ea, 10B Mb. Instance values are mutually exclusive with From and To capacityAmounts and range interval.

capacityAmountFrom.description: The low range value that a Capacity Amount can take on.

capacityAmountTo.description: The upper range value that CapacityAmount can take on.

rangeInterval.description:
An indicator that specifies the inclusion or exclusion of the capacityAmount From and capacityAmountTo attributes. 
Possible values are "open", "closed", "closedBottom" and "closedTop".

cancellationDate.description: Date when the reservation is cancelled.

cancellationReason.description: Reason why the reservation is cancelled.

completionDate.description: Date when the reservation was completed

creationDate.description: Date when the reservation was created

description.description: A string. free-text description of the reservation.

expectedCompletionDate.description: Expected completion date amended by the provider

requestedCompletionDate.description: Requested completion date from the requestor perspective

requestedStartDate.description: Reservation fulfillment start date wished by the requestor. This is used when, for any reason, requestor cannot allow the reservation to begin before a specific date.

stateChangeDate.description: The date and time the state changed.

stateChangeReason.description: The reason for changing the state

reservationPeriod.description: Period of time for which the target entity is to be in a reserved state

Resource.description: Resource is an abstract entity that describes the common set of attributes shared by all concrete resources (e.g. TPE, EQUIPMENT) in the inventory.

id.description: Identifier of an instance of the resource. Required to be unique within the resource type.  Used in URIs as the identifier for specific instances of a type.

href.description: The URI for the object itself.

category.description: Category of the concrete resource. e.g Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

endOperatingDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date till the resource is operating

name.description: A string used to give a name to the resource

resourceVersion.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a resource.

startOperatingDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date from which the resource is operating

administrativeState.description: Tracks the administrative state of the resource, such as locked, unlocked, shutdown and so on.

operationalState.description: Tracks the operational state of the resource, such as enable, disable and so on.

resourceStatus.description: Tracks the resource status of the resource, such as standby, alarm, available, reserved, suspended and so on.

usageState.description: Tracks the usage state of the resource, such as idle, active, busy and so on.

ResourceSpecificationRef.description:
Resources are physical or non-physical components (or some combination of these) within an enterprise's infrastructure or inventory. They are typically consumed or used by services (for example a physical port assigned to a service) or contribute to the realization of a Product (for example, a SIM card). They can be drawn from the Application, Computing and Network domains, and include, for example, Network Elements, software, IT systems, content and information, and technology components.
A ResourceSpecification is an abstract base class for representing a generic means for implementing a particular type of Resource. In essence, a ResourceSpecification defines the common attributes and relationships of a set of related Resources, while Resource defines a specific instance that is based on a particular ResourceSpecification.

Error.description: Used when an API throws an Error, typically with a HTTP error response-code (3xx, 4xx, 5xx)
